title: google earth submerged plane scotland
story: Robert Morton, , found the incredible image under the sea near Edinburgh.The father-of-three, from Doncaster, said the image appears to show an airliner underneath the waves.He toldthat the discovery was incredible and very strange.Robert, a mechanical fitter, said: I was just looking on Google Earth on Monday and, by chance, I came across the picture of the aircraft.It looks like it is the sea, just off the coast of Edinburgh. It looks like it is underwater.Its very, very strange. Its incredible.I have never actually seen an aircraft on Google Earth so it is very strange. It appears to be underwater.The bizarre image can be found around nine miles from Edinburgh airport, off the Scottish coast near Portobello.So what is the story behind the picture Robert says he has never heard of a plane crash in that region - and suggests there is an Earthly solution to the mystery.He described his find as a Google anomaly.Robert added added: I know the picture of the plane isnt really in the water, its probably the satellite looking down on it through thin cloud giving it that appearance.Google have been contacted for comment.It comes weeks after an amateur sleuth claimed to have found the wreckage of the doomed MH jet on Google Maps.Ian Wilson claims he has spotted the doomed jet lying in a high altitude area of the Cambodian jungle.The Malaysian Airlines plane vanished on March , , en route to Beijing from Kuala Lumper sparking one of the greatest mysteries in aviation history.

title: tui mexico wedding ban first dance toasts
story: Sarah Kinsella said she had to fork out just under £, for the all-inclusive wedding package in Mexico after the holiday company changed her contract details.Breaking down as she spoke to The Sun Online, Sarah, , said: A wedding should be the most exciting time of my le, and instead I’m in tears.I should be getting my bridesmaids ready but instead it’s all just stress.TUI has since apologised, saying they had readjusted her package.Sarah said her original contract stated her package for the April  wedding catered for up to  guests, with each additional guest costing USD .But the manager said she was later called by TUI and told that she needed to sign a new contract – that only catered for up to  guests.She had already invited  people to share in her big day.The distraught bride said after she signed the new contract she was told the hotel could not cater for a private wedding dinner and her guests would instead have to eat with other holidaymakers.On top of that, they would also not be allowed to give toasts or have a first dance.She said the changes meant she would have to fork out an extra, unexpected £, to have a private dinner where she could have toasts and a first dance - tipping the entire package to almost £,.Sarah said: “I was given all this information after I booked it and signed a contract.“They said it was restrictions of the hotel but they’re the company – they should have already known.”Sarah said she would be going through with the wedding, having already paid for the big day, but was frustrated at TUI’s customer service.She said: “I’ve just been getting fobbed off and no one wants to help.“All I wanted was an apology.“I want compensation for them ruining the most important day of my le.”A TUI spokesperson said: We are sorry to hear about the issues Ms Kinsella has faced with her upcoming wedding.We have been in touch with her and we have readjusted their wedding package.We know how important a wedding day is and we hope they have a lovely day celebrating.

title: tube strike central line rush hour updates
story: Members of the RMT and Aslef unions staged a -hour walkout on London Undergrounds Central Line in a dispute over industrial relations.The strike was being solidly supported, halting all services on the line, the second busiest on the network.Tube services on the Waterloo and City Line was also affected.To make matters worse for commuters, South Western Railway services to and from London Waterloo were delayed by a points failure.The RMT said the Tube dispute was over a comprehensive breakdown in industrial relations, a failure to employ enough drivers, abuse of agreed procedures and the victimisation of a trade union member.RMT general secretary Mick Cash said: RMT members are standing absolutely rock-solid and united theof the Central Line this morning as they send out the clearest possible signal that they will not be bullied into accepting a wholesale undermining of workplace justice and rights.Industrial relations along the Central Line have been at breaking point for some time now and the failure of the management to address the issues and a conscious decision to up the ante by attempting to single out and pick off inidual members of staff has tipped the situation over the edge and has led to the strike action today.The union is angry and frustrated that the management side have squandered a golden opportunity over the past week to resolve the issues at the heart of the dispute through the talks process.Todays action is the clearest possible demonstration to Tube bosses of the level of anger on the job and its down to them to take the situation seriously and engage in genuine talks around reaching a solution to the current disputes.SWR said it had been informed by Network Rail that a set of points has failed at London Waterloo - the countrys busiest railway station - so that three s were not in use.A message to passengers said: We are expecting cancellations to some services arriving at London Waterloo this morning, as well as delays because of the lost capacity of s.We strongly recommend you check your journey before you travel this morning.

title: keir starmer brexit second referendum
story: The Shadow Brexit Secretary is jetting off to Brussels today for talks with the blocs Brexit officials.He will also step up warnings about MPs voting for a blind Brexit today as he tries to stop Leave-backing Labour MPs like Caroline Flint and Gareth Snell from voting for Theresa Mays deal.The political plans for what our future relationship with the EU might look like wont be legally binding, unlike the withdrawal agreement which will be set in stone - and Labour will say we dont know exactly what it will look like.The party has said it wont back the PMs agreement unless it meets a series of tests - which it is unlikely to do.Ahead of his trip Sir Keir said: This is crunch time in the Brexit negotiations.He added: Yet government isions and delays mean that little time has been spent debating what our future trading and security relationship will be after Brexit.Months of deadlock in Theresa Mays government mean were facing continued uncertainty and the prospect of years of further negotiations over our future relationship with the EU.Some MPs fear that the -month transition period wont be long enough to seal a future trade deal with the bloc.And yesterday a Momentum poll showed that  per cent of the grassroots group want Labour to vote against the withdrawal deal.Many of them want a second referendum to overturn the result of our historic  vote.Labour plans to table a no-confidence vote in the PM and try and force a general electionMPs vote down her deal in the coming weeks.And yesterday the EUs Michel Barnier sparked fury by saying Britain could come BACK into the EU after Brexit.Theresa May has warned that another vote would destroy Brits trust in democracy - and she would NEVER hold one.Tory party chairman Brandon Lewis said Labour had spent the last two years doing everything they possibly can to frustrate the Brexit process and would continue to do so.He added: They promised to respect the referendum, but voted against the EU Withdrawal Act and now want to rerun the referendum, tearing up their pledge.Labour would take the country back to square one.Yesterday Theresa May insisted she would not seal a deal at any cost but said she was confident that one was on the cards.With just weeks left, Theresa May’s top table met for a mammoth three hours on Brexit in a bid to end deadlock over the Irish border.Attorney General Geoffrey Cox declared a climb down by Brussels this week to agree to look at a joint arbitration mechanism to decide when to end the backstop plan could be the basis to a compromise agreement.

title: how would your area vote in a second referendum on brexit
story: They say we need another referendum to make sure everyone voted properly before - even after .million people opted to Leave - and knew what that meant.Now expert pollsters from Survation have carried out extensive research trying to prove that we need another vote.They talked to , people across the UK to look at what would happenTheresa May called a snap Brexit vote tomorrow, something shes already ruled out many times.The results show that more people would now want to stay than quit. Of course, almost all the polls in the run up to the  referendum said the same thing, so lets take the results with a huge pinch of salt.So how would your area supposedly votewe had another go Boston would still be the region with the highest leave vote - at around  per cent opting again to quit the bloc.Other key leave areas including Thurrock, Castle Point, Rotherham, Doncaster, Scarborough and Great Yarmouth would still want to come out.Regionally, the East of England would still want to leave, along with the East Midlands, Yorkshire and the Humber and the South West.Scotland, Northern Ireland and London still want to Remain in the bloc.But other areas have attracted more Remain voters than back in  - pushing a possible vote in Remains area.Voters in Newham and Barking in London were most likely to change their minds, with big swings from Leave to Remain.But those in Harrogate and East Renfrewshire, Scotland, saw their votes basically unchanged from before.You can find your area by the interactive map below. Campaigners have been battling for another referendum on our EU membership for years - and last month , Brits marched on London to demand another vote.Last weekend a desperate Tony Blair urged MPs to vote down Mrs Mays final deal in a last ditch attempt to try and overturn the last result.And fascinating maps created by mapping and analytics company Esri UK revealed how the two Britains would lookthe entire country was ided physically into Leave and Remain land - based on the  poll.

title: baby show cake gross
story: Cake maker Rebecca Pilkington, , has had some odd requests over the years but perhaps the order she recently got for a baby shower tops the lot.The mum-of-three was asked to a make a cake for a customer’s sister who was pregnant.But the cake had to show the gory reality of childbirth.Rebecca, who set up her business Cake O Rama in Wigan seven years ago, told the Manchester Evening News: They came to me and said they had seen a picture of a babys head being born and they wanted one for a baby shower.They insisted that it had poo and it looked very realistic.I have been making cakes for the past seven years, but Ive never been asked to make one like that before.The cake maker started off by baking a standard sponge cake and then took three hours crafting the cake into shape by adding butter cream and strawberry jam before popping a doll’s head on the top and covering it with more jam as well as chocolate bits.Despite the gruesome appearance the customer was said to be very happy with the result.Rebecca said: I wouldnt be happyit was for my baby shower but for some reason loads of people love the idea.They thought it was hilarious.The most dficult part of the cake was the poo believe it or not, as its so hard make it look real.

title: web trolls backed by iran bid jeremy corbyn election
story: The regime apparently pumped out more than , messages in support of the hard-left Labour leader.The damning dossier of tweets includes vile claims that the partys anti-Semitism scandal was made up by Israel to smear Mr Corbyn.The Labour leader repeatedly appeared on Irans propaganda news channel before he became party boss.Twitter announced last month that it had deleted  accounts which were thought to be fronts for the Iranian government.The Sun can now reveal for the first time that those accounts sent , messages about Mr Corbyn, in an apparent bid to get Labour elected.The messages praised him for his views on Palestine - and sought to play down anti-Semitism in the party.One tweet read: The Israel lobby has sought to destroy #Corbyn since the moment he looked like winning the @UKLabour leadership.Another said: Zionist Inquisition in Full Cry Their quarry: anti-racist Labour leader #JeremyCorbyn. Their weapons: anti-semitism smears. Their purpose: to oust Corbyn and replace him with a compliant pro-Israel stooge.A third tweet said: The Israeli government has just been exposed running a campaign of lies and fake quotes to smear Jeremy Corbyn as anti-Semitic.One message suggested that anyone who doesnt support Mr Corbyn is a Tory, a fascist or very wealthy.Another declared: We are the true winners of the election.The tweets also praised Mr Corbyns opposition to nuclear weapons and the Nato nuclear alliance.There is no suggestion that Labour were aware of the Iranian campaign or supported it in any way.Before he became leader in , Mr Corbyn had longstanding links with Irans news channel PressTV.He was repeatedly paid to appear on the channel where he praised the despotic and criticised the West.Labour declined to comment.

title: photos prince charles life 70th birthday
story: The Prince of Wales is seen through the decades - from newborn baby and toddler to university student and naval officer.The collection shows his move into becoming a husband, father and globe-trotting king-in-waiting.His royal le is illustrated by each years snapshot of him with his family, at official events and touring the world.Charles, the nations longest-serving heir to the throne, turns  on November .The amazing photos give an insight into his le as a public figure and his relationships with the Queen, Prince Philip and his sons.

title: school bans kids playing football playground
story: Fuming parent Jimmy Barker, , who has two children at -pupil Moorlands Church of England Primary Academy, is among those to hit out at the ban.A letter was sent to families connected to the school, in Belton, near Great Yarmouth, saying that football has been banned because of health and safety concerns.Mr Barker said: We should be doing all we can to encourage children to be out in the fresh air and being active, not making it more dficult.Louise Arnold wrote: Surely its better the children playing football to let off some steam are on the school premises, rather than let them roam around first thing.He added: If children are on site before school doors open then they do not have any supervision andanything happened we would be liable.The has been brought in following a health and safety review.

title: baby cot comes with ipad
story: The cot, designed by Birmingham-based furniture company Babeek, was created to hold the technology so parents can play white nose and help babies go to sleep.But Dr Gary Allen, a chartered educational psychologist, described the creation as outrageous.He warned: Given the available literature surrounding screens and sleep and that of early attachment, creating a cot with a built in iPad is simply outrageous.Whilst it could be argued that it could be used as a nightlight, to play soothing melodies or be a means for a parent to keep their eye on their child.Cots are a safe place for sleeping and resting - period.Gary Taylor, owner of the Birmingham-based furniture company, defended the decision to include the iPad, saying he used it to play white noise to help his own nine-month-old baby girl go to sleep.He said: For me, it’s about getting our child to sleep.Speaking from his own experience, he said he and we Gemma had used their own phones to play white noise to baby Graysie sleep.But the music would often cut out when they received a call or message, disturbing the tot.To solve the problem, he said the white noise could be easily played from an iPad in a designated spot in the cot.He said: I’m looking at it from an outside point of view. If you are a hard working parent, sometimes even in the morning, I know some people put their kids in front of the TV in the morning, is that safe I was thinking thatthey could put it in the cot it could be a lot safer.”He added the iPad didnt have to be on constantly.He said: It’s not to sit your child in the cot all day watching Peppa Pig.People who work for a living thought it was a great idea.Without me being nasty, people who would leave their kid in the front room all day were hammering it.With the growing culture of smart phones, more and more people are peering at technology at night.But scientists have warned the blue light from your phone could have wide ranging implications.Blue waves are good during the day because they boost attention and reaction times, but can be extremely disruptive at night.The light plays havoc with our body clocks, with the light believed to be linked to affecting a persons circadian rhythm.It can also suppress the secretion of melatonin, affecting a persons mood.Researchers believe LED light, which emits mainly blue light, may disrupt the bodys internal clock and disrupt hormones to cause cancer.Experts have also warned too much screen time can raise the risk of a dozen deadly cancers as it fuels childhood obesity.*According to Hard HealthAnd he added he was merely giving people what they wanted.Mr Taylor said: Kids are stuck on their computers. That’s not my fault. That’s the way the generation is going. I’m giving people what they want.But parents took to social media to raise concerns about the built-in iPad design.Ana Belem said: “This is wrong on so many levels. There’s a limit for technology and this is just way over that limit!!! Shame on you.”Beth Cooper said: “Ffs! What is this world coming to, what a sick joke.”Danielle West added: “This has got to be a joke the most ridiculous thing ever. What’s wrong with reading singing talking about the day with your child to settle them for bed!”Research from the American Academy of Pediatricshas suggested it is the nature of screentime that is the most important factor.Jocelyn Brewer, a psychologist who specialises in the concept of digital nutrition, said: “It’s not just about whether you consume any potential digital junk foods, but also your relationship to technology and the role it plays in your family le.“We know that using screens to soothe or pacy kids sets up some concerning patterns of relying on devices to calm or distract a childfrom their experience of unpleasant or uncomfortable emotions – so we want to avoid using screens to placate tantrums, just like we want to avoid eating ‘treats’ to calm emotional storms.”

title: aldi customer never eat eggs again umbilical cord yolk
story: Annele Piercy, , posted a snap of the egg showing a perfect yolk with an oddly-shaped string-like substance within the white.While social media users told her they thought it was an “umbilical cord”, hens eggs do not have such a feature.Aldi was quick to point out it was simply a naturally-occurring part of the egg, which had been made more prominent by cooking.A spokesman said: It categorically is not an embryo. Our supplier only keeps female hens, making it impossible for this egg to become fertilised.Annele, from Durham, had posted an image of the weird find on Twitter with the caption: “This is what I found in my eggs that I bought. Put off eggs for le.”She bought the box of eggs from Aldi on November  at the chains store in Tyne and Wear.Among those to misinterpret the image online was user Suzanne Alban, who wrote: “God. It looks like the umbilical cord.”Another wrote: “Omg. What on earth is that ”Annele said: “I will not use eggs in the future. I felt so sick. I had my bacon in the pan so it all went in the bin.I did show it to my young children who were in shock and said I cooked a baby.“I have just started slimming world and eggs are a free food so I was excited for my breakfast.She continued: “I put my bacon and tomatoes in the pan and cooked them for a bit then I was ready for my eggs. I cracked the egg into the pan with my bacon.“Eww. To my horror it turned my stomach out in the pan. It was a baby embryo of a baby chick. I couldnt even look at it, from now on I will stick to bran flakes.”But a spokesman for Aldi today confirmed: “What Ms Piercy’s photograph shows is a naturally occurring part of the egg, which has become more prominent during cooking.We have spoken to Ms Piercy and she has accepted a full refund.”

title: theresa may release legal advice brexit
story: Tory Brexiteers, Labour bosses and the PMs DUP allies are all calling for Mrs May to hand over the full details of what lawyers have told her.Cabinet ministers fear the Irish backstop plan could see Britain permanently tied to the EUs customs union or end up breaking up the UK.Michael Gove led the calls for the PM to reveal exactly what advice Attorney General Geoffrey Cox has given her.He is understood to be backed by several other pro-Brexit ministers.Mrs May is close to a deal with Brussels which would see the UK stay in the customs union for as long as there is no other way of keeping the Irish border open.She wants to insert a clause allowing Britain to pull out of the backstop - but the EU is resisting the suggestion.The two sides are now trying to come up with a compromise review mechanism which could bring the backstop to an end in future.The DUPs Jeffrey Donaldson demanded to see Mr Coxs legal advice and even threatened to bring the Government down over the issue.He told the BBC: “We’re not afraid of a General Election.If the House of Commons is going to have a meaningful vote on a deal upon which this legal advice is very important, then I think people are entitled to know what that legal advice is.Shadow Brexit Secretary Keir Starmer, who is also a QC, added: “Any agreement on the backstop can’t simply be a fudge that’s cobbled together to satisfy Theresa May’s Cabinet.“It must be a robust and credible proposal that guarantees there will be noto a hard border in Northern Ireland after Brexit.“That’s why it’s essential MPs are given the opportunity to scrutinise the Attorney General’s legal advice before voting on the final deal.And Labour MP Ian Murray, a backer of the anti-Brexit Best for Britain campaign, blasted: The public was lied to during the EU referendum, so the Government now has a moral duty to ensure full transparency.“The voters are being treated with contempt by a government determined to railroad through Brexit.

title: china weather control plan satellites
story: Six satellites will form a ring to spot water-laden clouds and create an atmospheric corridor to allow them to move to the arid regions, state media said.Tianhe  which translates as Sky River  is being developed by the Shanghai Academy of Spaceflight Technology and will reportedly be launched in .China’s damp southern regions often flood while the north suffers drought.But the problem is having enough rain clouds to instigate downpours with.Now state scientists and researchers are pursuing weather modication techniques to guide clouds north to the Yellow River basin, which is particularly dry.The idea of controlling the weather is far from new in China. In  the country seeded clouds with silver iodide to ensure they rained away from the Beijing Olympics. Long term the goal is to push  billion cubic metres of rain water each year north to the Yellow River basin. But the scientists have not revealed how they are going to create channels of air through which to push the rain clouds. The Peoples Daily said they would analyse the where they were before deploying a new type of manual intervention technology to move them north.The project is the brainchild of Wang Guangqian, an academic with the Chinese Academy of Sciences, Zhu Wei.He is also chief designer of the satellites and said the orbiters would be equipped with devices dedicated to measuring temperature and humidity in the atmosphere and moisture levels in clouds.

title: brexit deal draft agreement ministers theresa may
story: Ministers have been invited to read the draft agreement in the Cabinet Office.A special Cabinet meeting is then likely to take place tomorrow or Monday so ministers can sign off on the text.But the current version doesnt include the crucial Irish backstop needed to avoid a hard border.That means further talks could be needed with Brussels before the final deal is complete.Ministers met in No yesterday to discuss the details of the deal Theresa May wants to strike with the EU.Today they were told they could read the finalised text, without the backstop.They will then meet again within the next few days to give the PM authorisation to finalise the deal.But a senior Government source told The Sun the agreement isnt ready yet because Britain and the EU havent struck a deal on the backstop.Both sides have agreed there needs to be a mechanism to keep the Irish border open regardless of the outcome of future trade talks.That is likely to see Britain stay in the EU customs union until a permanent solution is found.The UK wants the right to withdraw from the backstop at any time. But Brussels has insisted it must be binding for as long as there is no other way of avoiding a hard border.The two sides are now working on a compromise review mechanism which could end the arrangement in the future.David Cameron today backed Mrs May, telling Sky News: I fully support what shes doing and want to let her get on with the job.

title: indonesia plane grounded worlds smelliest fruit durians
story: The Sriwijaya Air flight immediately descended into chaos when passengers boarded because of a sickening smell caused by sacks of durians in the jets baggage hold.Although durians are known as king of fruits to some, their unique odour has been known to trigger powerful disgust responses in others, with their smell being likened to rotting onions, turpentine, and even raw sewage.Furious travellers on the plane felt so nauseated by the fruits potent stench that they demanded it be unloaded before takeoff.Amir Zidane, who was appalled by the smell, later posted online: When I entered the plane, I could already smell the scent of durian.I complained to the stewardess but they told me to just fill up a complaint form.I yelled at other passengers: Who on this plane wants to fly They all chanted back: Not us!Amir even said that the smell was so bad that some people almost physically clashed with the airline staff.Eventually, pressure on the cabin crew forced them to unload the horrible fruit - with the domestic flight setting off an hour later than scheduled from Jakarta, the Indonesian capital.Sriwijaya Air later defended its decision to carry the smelly fruit according to local newspapers.A spokesperson told the Jakarta Post: Its not illegal to carry durians in a flight as long as it is wrapped properly in accordance with flight regulations [and] carried inside the hold.The word durian comes from a Malay word meaning thorn, describing the spiky rind on the fruit.The fruits smell is so potent that many public transportation systems in Asia explicitly ban commuters from eating them while travelling.

title: tinder lover 69 who identifies as a 49 year old takes legal action to change his age so he can date younger users
story: Emile Ratelband, , arguestransgender people are allowed to change sex, he should be allowed to change his birth date as docs say he has the body of a younger man.The entrepreneur and self-help guru is even suing his local authority after they refused the amend his age on official documents.Mr Ratelbands case has now gone to a court in the city of Arnhmen in the eastern Dutch provice of Gelderland.He was born on th March , but says he feels at least  years younger and wants to change his birth date to th March .Mr Ratelband said: I have done a check-up and what does it show  My biological age is  years.When Im , I am limited. If Im , then I can buy a new house, drive a dferent car. I can take up more work.When Im on Tinder and it say Im , I dont get an answer. When Im , with the face I have, I will be in a luxurious position.Transgenders can now have their gender changed on their birth certicate, and in the same spirit there should be room for an age change.The Dutchman said he is discriminated against because of his age, and that he encounters problems in society on a daily basis.He complains that companies are reluctant to hire someone the age of a pensioner as a consultant.And he says his move would also be good news for the government as he would be renouncing his pension until he reaches retirement age again.The judge said that he had some sympathy with Mr Ratelband as people could now change their gender which would once have been unthinkable.But the court said there would be practical problems in allowing people to change their birth date - as it would mean legally deleting part of their livesThe judge asked Mr Ratelband about the status of his early years, from  to ,his official birth date was put back.For whom did your parents care in those years  Who was that little boy back then , the judge asked.The court is due to deliver a written ruling within four weeks.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: bell ringer sues church

title: irish border backstop brexit legal advice
story: Shadow Brexit secretary Keir Starmer said his party will use “parliamentary procedures”the PM withholds the dossier on the Irish backstop, demanded by MPs across the Brexit ide.The fresh headache for the PM came as she rang German leader Angela Merkel and EU Council boss Donald Tusk today.Mrs May pleaded with them to keep the chance of a deal this month alive as she admitted she still needs more time to work up a compromise plan to allow the UK to one day escape the Irish backstop that keeps us in the customs union.She will also lobby Dutch PM Mark Rutte at a NATO dinner in Brussels tomorrow and French president Emmanuel Macron in Paris on Friday.Without a deal this month, there will not be enough time for the government to pass all the necessary laws to enact it in time for Brexit on March .The demand to see lawyers’ verdict in full on the escape mechanism was repeated to Mrs May by Environment Secretary and former Leave campaign boss Michael Gove in Cabinet on Tuesday.Mr Starmer joined the call as he arrived in Brussels to tell EU chiefs Labour will vote down the deal they reach with Mrs Mayit fudges the detail on future trade.His remarks followed similar calls from the DUP, Lib Dems and Tory backbench Brexiteers.Mr Starmer said: “I hope the Government has the good sense to realise that this is so important it makes it available in Parliament.“If they don’t want to we’ll have to think about what devices what procedures we can use to force them to do so.”He hinted that Labour would look to once again use an ancient procedure called a humble address to force Mrs May’s hand.The party successfully deployed the tactic to secure the release of the Government’s explosive Brexit impact assessments last December.DUP chief whip Sir Jeffrey Donaldson said: “I think it’s in the public interest we understand fully what’s happening here.“It’s because it affects the whole UK, therefore it shouldn’t just be the DUP that sees this advice, or the Government.“If the House of Commons is going to have a meaningful vote on a deal that includes, and upon which this legal advice is very, very important, then I think people are entitled to know what that advice is.”Meanwhile Tory Brexiteer trio Steve Baker, Jacob Rees-Mogg and Michael Gove insisted the Cabinet be given the dossier at the very least.Mr Starmer said the Labour leadership has not yet held talks with other parties about teaming up to defeat the Government.The shadow Brexit secretary also warned there was risk of the “purgatory of permanent negotiations”the UK leaves without a “precise” blueprint.He laid down the ultimatum in a meeting with eurocrats including Jean-Claude Juncker’s deputy, Frans Timmermans, on a trip to Brussels yesterday.He said: “It’s not acceptable to expect the Labour Party or any parliamentarian to vote for a blind Brexit where we don’t know where we’re heading.“Labour will not back a blind Brexit that’ll simply increase uncertainty and open the door to a Tory hard Brexit. That’s not in the national interest.“Time is running out there are still dficulties in the negotiations here, but more so around the Cabinet table.“What I’d say to the PM is negotiate in the national interest not negotiate something you think will just get through your Cabinet.”Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: jeff sessions resigns attorney general
story: The President tweeted his thanks to Sessions, and announced an interim replacement in a pointed statement.He said: We are pleased to announce that Matthew G. Whitaker, Chief of Staff to Attorney General Jeff Sessions at the Department of Justice, will become our new Acting Attorney General of the United States. He will serve our Country well.We thank Attorney General Jeff Sessions for his service, and wish him well! A permanent replacement will be nominated at a later date.In the resignation letter to Trump, Sessions said the resignation came at your request.During his two-year tenure, Sessions and Trump endured a fractious relationship as while Sessions was one of the presidents earliest supporters, relations had become strained in recent months.In the resignation letter, Sessions said he was honoured to be sworn in as Attorney General, and worked to implement the law enforcement agenda that formed a central part of Trumps campaign.Just weeks into the attorney generals tumultuous tenure, he stepped aside from the investigation into the alleged meddling between the presidents campaign and Russia.Trump blamed Sessions decision for opening the door to the appointment of special counsel Robert Mueller, who took over the Russia investigation and began examining whether Trumps hectoring of Sessions was part of a broader effort to obstruct justice and stymie the probe.Top Democrat on the House Judiciary Committee Rep. Jerry Nadler says he wants answers immediately after Jeff Sessions was forced out as attorney general by President Donald Trump.Nadler is in line to become the chairman of the Judiciary  when Democrats take control of the House in January. Last night, he tweeted that we will be holding people accountable.Democrats worry that firing Sessions is a path to removing special counsel Robert Mueller and trying to end the probe into the Russia investigation.Nadler says he wants to know why Trump is making the change and who has authority over Special Counsel Muellers investigation Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer says it is paramount that the investigation of special counsel Robert Mueller be protected by President Donald Trumps new attorney general.Schumer says he finds the timing of Sessions departure very suspect, and tweeted that the president has something to hide.The New York Democrat says it would spark a constitutional crisisTrump forced out Sessions as a prelude to ending or limiting Muellers investigation.Former senior advisor to President Obama, Dan Pfefer warned: Trump is ending the Mueller investigation right before our eyes andyou expect the Republicans to do anything about it you have been sleepwalking through the last two years.Democrat Congressman - and ranking member of the Ethics Committee - Ted Deutch also said the resignation is the first step toward removing the special counsel and burying its findings before the Dems take power next year.

title: lenny henry arts vital for a childs sense of inclusion
story: And good people are saying good and sensible things about children and the arts - it just feels like no one really cares. And the problem is that the creative arts are a huge boost to the GDP of Great Britain.In January, thesaid the creative industries were "worth #bn to the UK economy"."The sector s more golden eggs to the Treasury than the automotive, oil, gas, aerospace and le science industries combined, and for every # invested in subsidy the government gets # ed in taxes."So why is the government cutting back on the creative arts in schools  Why this insistence on STEM , this rejection of the arts The truth is, this was always going to happen. When I was at Blue Coat secondary modern there was little or no attempt to cultivate dramatic aspirations during the school day. Sure, we were tasked with reading aloud or taking part in an assembly we even did a school concert the year I had successfully auditioned for New Faces. But the only drama I remember taking part in was when Mr Kipperwould have us in the hall for a double period and make us run around pretending to be characters we had seen on television or at the pictures.When we were kids, there were not many chances to pop into a performance of Hedda Gabler or the Dolls House. The fact is, theatre didnt play a massive part in my parents lives. They spent every hour God gave putting food on the table and clothes on our backs. They were not also going to pop us in for a matinee of She Stoops To Conquer at the Wolverhampton Civic. They werent made of money. So, no theatre.

title: peter lawrence id give up my obe in a flash to see claudia again
story: But I would give up all the recognition and accolades in a flash just to see my daughter again - it will be  years ago next March that I last saw her.Claudia went missing on her way to work as a chef at the University of York. Her last known contact was when she spoke to her mother by phone.She failed to attend work the next day and was later reported missing. Despite a massive police investigation nobody has been charged in connection with her disappearance.Sometimes it feels like yesterday, and sometimes it feels much more like  years since Claudia disappeared.It was so sudden and she was such a close part of our lives that the impact was instant.I used to see Claudia frequently and we would go out for drinks and meals, and then we couldnt any longer.Not having closure is the worst thing about it because I can go for walks on a sunny day, but think "What is Claudia seeing  What happened  Where are you ":: Claudias Law to help families of missing people clears parliamentYou dont stop thinking ever, I certainly dont stop thinking about Claudia.She was  when she went missing so I often think how she would now be a completely dferent person and how sad it is that weve missed all that time.I think all parents going through the same thing deal with it in a similar way.

title: mind take esther mcvey twitter
story: NewsMind take on Esther McVey on Twitter after she claims they back Universal Credit changesThe charity were not happy with her comments in ParliamentShareCommentsByNicola BartlettPolitical Correspondent:,  NOV Updated:,  NOV News "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailMind have hit back at Esther McVey after she claimed the mental health charity supported her changes to Universal Credit in a parliamentary debate. The Secretary of State for Work and Pensions attacked the Labour Party saying they could not bring themselves to praise the extra money going into UC. The Government was forced to put more money in after campaigning from the Mirror, MPs and charities. She then read out a list of charities she said had praised the pound.billion injection in to the scheme announced in the budget last week including the Resolution Foundation, and the Child Poverty Action Group. She added: Other charities have been saying that the Department is now listening to what claimants, charities and MPs are saying. The Trussell Trust has said that. Gingerbread has said that. Mind has said that. Mencap has said that. But Mind hit back at her claim. The charity says they have never supported the scheme - even after the recent changes. They are especially concerned that three million people, including hundreds of thousands of people with mental health problems, will be forced to make a new claim. In a Twitter thread the charity explained the many criticisms and warning it has made about the benefits shake-up.  The Mind twitter account stated: Yesterday the Secretary of State for Work and Pensions @EstherMcVey mentioned us in a list of organisations who had recognised and welcomed changes to #UniversalCredit. We thought it was important to set the record straight. They listed the warnings in order showing how they had consistently criticised the policy. Minds Director of External Relations Sophie Corlett expressed concerns when the Government first published its plans for moving people from older benefits onto Universal Credit in July. She said: We are hugely concerned about the ramications of these proposals, which leave open the real possibility that many people with mental health problems could see their benefits stopped entirely while they struggle with the process of applying Universal Credit. The Mirror are demanding a halt to the expansion of Universal Credit and for a review to take place. We say there are three options:Redesign UC to be fit for purpose Axe it in favour of the old systemUC is unfixable Introduce a brand new systemSign our petition to stop the rollout of Universal Credit across Britain and to replace it with a fairer system by signing our petition. The thread then moved on to show Minds response to the governments recent budget announcement, via chief executive Paul Farmer, who said: If the government is really intent on prioritising the nations mental health, it needs to guarantee nobody with mental health problems will be left without their income as a result of moving to Universal Credit. The charitys head of Policy Vicki Nash was particularly scathing in her comment after the updated plans were announced. As the thread shows, she said: These regulations have confirmed what we have long feared and argued against - that in the move over to Universal Credit three million people, including hundreds of thousands of people with mental health problems, will be left without income and pushed into poverty. A DWP spokesperson said: The Secretary of State remains absolutely committed to working closely with key charities and stakeholders. She values their feedback and meets with them regularly for constructive discussions as Universal Credit rolls out.

title: boohoo criticised after security guard
story: NewsBoohoo criticised after security guard tells homeless man to move from doorwayVideo footage has been shared of the incident outside the online retailers Northern Quarter branch in ManchesterShareCommentsBySophie Halle-Richards:,  NOV Updated:,  NOV Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror incoming video boohoo-homeless-row-after-security-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,video.header.bidding.enabled:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,video.header.bidding.enabled:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailBoohoo has been been criticised after a security guard told a homeless man to move from the doorway of their head office. Video footage of the incident has been shared by mum-of-three Deborah Henley, who had been helping the man - known as Tom. She spotted him looking unwell and according to reports he had been discharged from hospital that day following an assault which had left him with three stab wounds. Tom was sat on the steps outside the online retailers Northern Quarter branch in Manchester, trying to warm up with a cup of coffee. But Deborah says shes ashamed about what happened next, the Manchester Evening News reports. She claims she and the homeless man were told by the security guard they had to move, despite the shutters being closed. In the footage, a member of security staff appears to be guarding the closed shutter where the man had been resting. It was clear the man was in a bad way, Deborah said.  Speaking to the Manchester Evening News, Deborah said: It was just shameful, I am so ashamed about what happened. I was waiting in my car and saw a young man looking very unwell sat outside the steps outside. His hands were blue and he clearly wasnt well so I left to get him a coffee. He wasnt begging or asking for money. When I came back, a member of security came out of Boohoo and said we couldnt sit there. She says she told the security guard she had wanted to sit with him whilst he gathered himself, and then they would leave. But she claims she was told that they must clear the doorway immediately. This man had just got out of hospital with three stab wounds, Deborah said. I dont know how anyone could not have allowed a human being to sit there for five minutes. The security guard said that his plastic bags were the problem, butit was a Selfridges bag I doubt it would have mattered.  The pair moved on to the pavement so Tom could sit and finish his coffee, but Deborah claims the guard prevented them from sitting there too. He was bullying us just to get this man moved, she added. It was an upsetting situation as it was but the security guard just wasnt having any of it. I came home and felt really upset so I wrote to Boohoo, but I felt their reply was really weak. There were lots of workers outside smoking and drinking coffee - nobody looked scared or intimidated. Deborah says she believes more needs to be done to provide a place for homeless people to rest and take shelter during daylight hours, especially in the winter months. She said: I have written to Andy Burnham because the message just isnt getting out there. When a man cant even sit on a step and rink a coffee, something is very wrong. The Bed a Night campaign is an excellent idea, but there are still  hours in the day where people have nowhere to sit and rest. I know security staff have got a job to do but there was nobody coming in and out of that door. I understand that these companies have rules but at some point humanity has to prevail. A spokesperson from Boohoo said: Boohoo take the issue of homelessness very seriously, working with the council over the last  months to support and taking part in charity initiatives which help the most vulnerable people in our community. We are aware of the incident and we did politely ask the lady and gentlemen to move away from the steps of our building, as we would anyone to remain vigilant with respect to access to the building. title: corrie mckeagues mum lashes out
story: NewsCorrie McKeagues mum lashes out at police and accuses them of LYING about bodyNicola Urquhart has shared a scathing post criticising Suffolk Police as she reveals evidence son is not in landfill siteShareCommentsByAmber Hicks:,  NOV Updated:,  NOV Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror incoming video corrie-mckeague-inquiry-disappearance-raf-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,video.header.bidding.enabled:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,video.header.bidding.enabled:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailCorrie McKeagues mum has lashed out at police and accused them of lying about the missing airmans body. Nicola Urquhart claims senior officers have been dishonest and that evidence linked to the mystery disappearance of the -year-old is being concealed. Her accusations come weeks after police confirmed the most likely conclusion is that Corrie was taken away in a Bfa bin and to the rubbish tip in Milton, Cambridgeshire, after climbing in the bin and falling asleep. But despite extensive searches of the landfill, a body has never been found. Gran Nicola wrote on the Find Corrie Facebook page: They [police] just hope that by saying all the evidence points to Corrie being there makes it true and us the family and the public will be stupid enough to believe it.  Nicola believes Corrie was not in the bin when he vanished on September  in  after a night out in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk. She claims an eyewitness saw Corrie close to where he was last seen and checked the bin and Corrie was not inside. Suffolk police would like me to discount this statement as being untrue, she said. Yetthey feel they have been lied to they have done nothing and refuse to do anything about this. Nicola also claims data regarding the bin weight was interfered with and Corries phone signal on the same route the bin lorry took is absolutely not conclusive and could have been within five miles.  Police previously said the bin weighed kg - much higher than bin collection weights from the same place normally. A Suffolk Police spokesman said last month: Our findings were that the weights of these bins were consistently lowand it was extremely unusual for the Greggs bin collection on a Saturday to be anywhere near KG let alone over this figure. In the whole of this yearly period we identied only one other occasion where the weight exceeded kg, other than a date where a system error had occurred which recorded a weight in excess of KG which is known to be impossible. But Nicola raged today that there was not one trace of DNA on or in the bin, on or in the Bfa lorry. She said: The Bfa raw data was interfered with. It is NOT conclusive fact that the bin was kg.  Evenwe accept it was, in the year from Jan  to Jan  the Greggs bin WAS regularly over kg and frequently over kg. Regardless of what day of the week this was it was still over and Suffolk police have stated as a FACT that it was over  kg on a previous Saturday but this is to be ignored as are all the failed readings and the ones were it was over kg or kg. She continued: Suffolk police being baffled as to why they did not find Corrie and cannot explain it. Nor are they trying too. Meanwhile, Nicola went on to make scathing accusations about police officers claiming: We have been misled and lied to by the senior officers investigating the disappearance of Corrie, they have played word games, played a media game and have tried to only provide us with information that fits their preferred theory at the time.  Corrie is a grown man and is responsible for himself, as i said at the start, he is responsible for his own actions, we as a family are not looking for someone to blame for what has happened to Corrie, we are looking for the truth and we want to find Corrie. In Summary….. It is possible Corrie left on foot and is AWOL….. i do not and have never believed this is probable, Corrie made no plans, had no reason and has never been seen after the immediate sightings. Most importantly, as a family we know thatCorrie could see the way some people are behaving not a single person in the world could stop him from screaming from the rooftops about how he would feel about that.  Corries father Martin heartbreakingly admitted last month my son is gone after police confirmed his sons body was probably in a landfill site. Meanwhile in response to Nicolas allegations, a Suffolk Constabulary spokesman said: “Suffolk Constabulary refutes the allegations made in the Facebook post by Nicola Urquhart that senior officers have been dishonest in their approach. “Everything we have said and done has been in good faith and for the right reasons. We have sought to be as open and transparent as possible with the family. “This investigation was conducted in line with the Code of Ethics. The most likely scenario is that Corrie McKeague unfortunately went into the bin which was emptied into the Bfa lorry and consequently ended up in the waste process. “We have come to this conclusion based on all of the evidence we have available to us, and not just the weight of the bin.  “Our investigation has been reviewed by an outside force and the review agreed that Suffolk Constabulary’s preferred hypothesis of what happened to Corrie was the most likely one given the evidence available. “Suffolk Constabulary has previously stated that unless new, realistic and credible information becomes available then the investigation is complete. There is no information available at this time that changes the status of the investigation.”  Nicolas Facebook post in full: Instead of replying inidually to each private message i thought it would be easier to put a post up, as most of you are asking the same type of questions. It is very hard to explain simply as i can’t describe the last  years in a short post. My aim here is to explain why myself and my family will not move on and try to forget about Corrie, we are not ready to remember Corrie, we are still fighting for him. This is because we have been misled and lied to by the senior officers investigating the disappearance of Corrie, they have played word games, played a media game and have tried to only provide us with information that fits their preferred theory at the time. I would like to make the distinction now, that it is not and has never been rank and file officers, nor is it the entire force. It is the senior officers that have spoken to myself and my sons and the officers above them that have decided to run the investigation into my son the way they have. I am incredibly grateful for the huge amount of effort that has been put into trying to find Corrie and this is not a post that in hindsight it is simply me looking back and complaining now, as you all know I have been very vocal from the start when i disagree or cannot understand why decisions have been made the way they have been. but hopefully it will explain things. Corrie is a grown man and is responsible for himself, as i said at the start, he is responsible for his own actions, we as a family are not looking for someone to blame for what has happened to Corrie, we are looking for the truth and we want to find Corrie. POSSIBLE, PROBABLE and EVIDENCE  words that have been used quite a lot. i will talk about this later. Corrie walked into the rear loading bays behind Greggs in Bury St Edmunds. that is a fact. Wewere told in the first phone calls from Suffolk Police that they were at that stage .% sure Corrie could not leave the area without being caught on CCTV, and the area Corrie had walked into was a dead end. I asked about assistance from the RAF and I was told the RAF had said it was not their problem, This was absolutely not what I was being told by the most senior member of the RAF at the time, when I pointed this out I was then told “ it wouldn’t be fair on other families of missing people, they wouldn’t get the same as Corrie. ” this was the excuse I was given for Suffolk Police not asking for more assistance from the RAF who were desperate to help and had offered assistance at no cost. but the RAF cannot be involved unless requested by the police force investigating. Moving on, we were told Corrie had not gone in the Bfa lorry as the weight was too light kg. we were also then told it was impossible for Corrie to leave the area without being caught on CCTV.During this time, this was also what I was telling all of you, as for as far as I am concerned in a missing person enquiry ALL information should be put out to the public. I was begging Suffolk Police during this time not to give back the landfill to FCC as it was too soon, I was not saying I wanted it searched, just that it was far to soon to give up as even at this stage I could not see how they were so confident in the kg weight. I was at a meeting with Suffolk Police when they showed me images of the male in the black and white t shirt that was in Pizza Mama Mia and i was told the police were looking for this male as they had not identied him yet. . I said i would put his image on the find Corrie page and i was asked not to as they didn’t want to start asking people who he was yet, as they wanted to stagger the information. this was something I was most certainly not happy with so I put a description and photograph of the t shirt the male was wearing on the find Corrie page and the male in question contacted me immediately telling me it was him. he also described his full night and everything he knew about Corrie. I immediately passed this on to the police and they spoke to him, however never got half the story I did. i questioned this and showed them the messages I had been sent. the male was spoken to again and told not to talk to me. yet he in my eyes had done nothing wrong and was only trying to help. During this time I was told that although Corrie’s phone had been logged at Five Roads Roundabout at Barton Mills the area between there and Honington was  square miles and too large for the Police to search. that only with a phone ping it was not a reasonable request to have the area searched, even though this was an area Corrie knew and the RAF used to tab train the airmen. It was agreed by Police for the searches by SULSAR with the assistance of the public could take place. After insisting that the images of the people the police were searching for were shown to the public it was finally agreed that the police would put a pod up in Bury showing these images. it was during this time I met Colin Davey, he informed me that he had already offered a reward to Suffolk Police for me and they had refused him, he insisted and they said they would tell me but they did not, I spoke with the senior officer in charge and asked him about this and he said he had no knowledge, it was later ascertained the police did know about the offer but in their opinion felt it wasn’t worth telling me. I then spoke frequently about getting this reward made public, after speaking with Colin on numerous occasions and on every occasion i was stopped by police and told i should wait, what I didn’t know was at the same time they were talking to someone  about a much smaller reward they now wanted to put up and were assisting them every way they could. I informed the police that a press conference was about to take place and they pretended they had no knowledge while all the time they knew exactly what was about to be said and offered yet I was still being told not to put up a reward. yet again another time Suffolk Police were playing games and not simply trying everything in their power to find Corrie and to have everyone working together and not one constantly attacking. One of the big sticking points in the Reward that Colin had offered was that the police would not and could not answer the phones  hours a day. we spoke atabout this and how it could be resolved. I offered to pay officers and for a line to be opened but it was all refused so an agreement was made that i would have my own phones. It was on one of these calls that I received myself that i was provided with information relating to persons killing Corrie and putting him in the Greggs bin and Corrie ultimately ending up in the landfill. This as with ALL information that was received was passed on to Suffolk Police, I was told to keep this new information secret while it was investigated as the police took this information extremely seriously. This in my opinion caused Suffolk police to go back and start looking at the bin weight and the processes of Bfa again, it was only after this they then decided to start the search of the Landfill. With all this going on I had been lied to by senior officers about facts of the case surrounding vehicles and had been deliberately misled about other things. I was updating you all during this time with what I believed were facts as I had been told them, Suffolk Police have always been happy for it to appear that it is me that is changing my story, i believe to attack my credibility, whilst all the time they refused to say anything to the media as they knew they had a puppet repeating what they wanted to be put out in social media and the press. The search at the landfill started, I was still questioning why this was happening and was being told it was not , but when they would find Corrie. The language the police were using was CERTAIN. and to my utter regret, i believed them and stopped asking all my other questions. Suffolk Police searched the landfill, the entire area they believed Corrie may have been and did not find a single item of evidence to suggest Corrie was ever there, yet they did find rubbish from the time and dates Corrie went missing and from the Bury area. I have no doubt what so ever thatVince and his team searching would have found Corrie or any items belonging to Corriethey had been there, I visited them, at the site and spoke with them, I just didn’t feel the need to seek attention for it. Whilst there I was told they did not believe Corrie was there, they were not going to find him. I was also told other things but i won’t share them just now. Suffolk Police then found out that the weights were wrong, the bin actually weighted kg and this was so exceptional it could only mean Corrie was in that bin that night, again I have asked and been shown so much data from Bfa and on each occasion it has dramatically changed from the time before. it has never remained consistent at all. It was only  years after my son had gone missing that we were finally showed the REAL raw data and even then it showed, contrary to the misleading statements that have been put out there that the Bfa bin for Greggs ARE regularly over kg. In the year Corrie went missing I am supposed to ignore so many occasions that the bin was over kg with no explanation at all.I have never been given any explanation as to why it was only the one night when a Bfa member of staff a week after Corrie went missing interfered with the weights of the bins. In the whole year this was the ONLY occasion. Suffolk police are happy to move on from this. I am not. It was also only at this last meeting I was also informed that ACTUALLY CORRIE COULD HAVE LEFT THE AREA WITHOUT BEING SEEN ON CCTV. Suffolk Police cannot confirm Corrie wasn’t given a lt out of the area. ALL they can say is they didn’t see him leave before am, after that, they have NOT even looked!!! as they do not have the CCTV, they never even asked for it. We have been shown CCTV of people in the area of the horseshoe just after Corrie walked in there, all are wearing dark clothing you then see them leaving the area and one is clearly wearing white or very light coloured trousers. These people leave the area walking down Short Brackland street immediately after the bin lorry left. The Bin Lorry Driver confirms seeing Corrie in his statement and not being there along with the others he had seen when he drove out, this is also confirmed by CCTV as it shows these people leaving the area. I am expected to believe that these people changed there clothes and it wasn’t Corrie.This is no where close to all the information I have, or the problems we have had to endure and the unbelievable unneeded stress and heartache Suffolk Police have put us under as a family. In Summary….. It is possible Corrie left on foot and is AWOL….. i do not and have never believed this is probable, Corrie made no plans, had no reason and has never been seen after the immediate sightings. most importantly, as a family we know thatCorrie could see the way some people are behaving not a single person in the world could stop him from screaming from the rooftops about how he would feel about that. Had it been Darroch or Makeyan that had gone missing there is no way on this world I could have expected the same restraint at the disgust and anger they feel and to keep quiet from Corrie, any one that knows Corrie at all, knows just how true this statement is. Corrie is NOT in the landfill, and never was, forensics, a search of Red Lodge, a search of the entire Landfill shows this. I have spoken atwith the staff at Red lodge and I firmly believe that had Corrie been dropped there by the Bfa bin the staff there would have seen him. There is also the search carried out by Suffolk Police,Corrie was there, they would have found him, they have in fact proven to me beyond all reasonable doubt that he was never there. So along with the statements, the evidence of statements and CCTV it shows Corrie leaving the area on foot, this is also where a now proven search dog traced Corrie, walking down Short Brackland and out of Bury along the A. There are discussions going on just now with a charity search Dive team that can do searches of water that SULSAR are unable to do along with the searches that SULSAR have been carrying out and areas that still need to be searched. This is what is POSSIBLE and what is PROBABLE. Sadly we are left as a family feeling very let down by a profession that I am so so very proud to be a part of. Suffolk Police gave up searching for Corrie in November  everything since has simply been lip service to us and you. I hoped the mistakes would have been a learning experience and would never happen again, but sadly this is not what has happened. I have been out searching for Corrie myself along this road and I will continue to do all I can to make sure it is searched and my son is found. I will not give up, neither will Corrie’s brothers or our family. I will also do all i possibly can to make sure no other mother, brother, daughter, family or friend ever has to go through what we have been put through, Corrie going missing is the most heartbreaking tragic thing that has ever happened to us as a family but what Suffolk Police have put us through has been unimaginable and unforgivable. but most importantly unnessarry i have tried on so many occasion privately to get them to behave in a way that would give the public they serve some confidence, sadly they appear to me to have lost sight of that and do not wish to do anything to encourage that trust and belief, that saddens me as I know it will not be how the majority of their force feels. I know this is a fact from the officers that have contacted me privately. Again I have not covered anywhere close to all the information I have, nor all the things that Suffolk Police have done or not done. I will continue to live in hope that lessons can be learnt and there is no need for me to publicly say everything. Thank you all so very much for your continued amazing support Nicola, Makeyan, Corrie and Darroch x x x x

story: NewsEnfield man, , pictured fighting for le after senseless attack in own homePeter Gouldstone, , from Enfield, was attacked in his London home and suffered two bleeds on the brain with politan Police investigatingShareCommentsByTom DavidsonOnline Reporter:,  NOV Updated:,  NOV NewsPeter Gouldstone in a hospital bed after he was attacked and robbed in his own home "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThis is the first picture of the -year-old man fighting for his le in hospital after being battered in his own home.Police believe widower Peter Gouldstone was attacked in his bedroom. title: hopes kirsty maxwells family dashed
story: NewsHopes for Kirsty Maxwells family dashed after DNA test results revealedKirsty Maxwell, , from Livingston, Scotland, was on a hen weekend in Benidorm when she fell from the tenth-floor apartment of a room in which five men were stayingShareCommentsByGerard CouzensBradley Jolly:,  NOV NewsThe probe into Kirsty Maxwells death has been extensive "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe heartbroken family of a holidaymaker who plunged to her death from a tenth-floor apartment room in Benidorm has had their hopes of a DNA breakthrough in the ongoing probe dashed. Kirsty Maxwell, , was on a hen weekend in the Spanish resort when the tragedy happened. Her family has since supported an extensive probe into her death after it emerged five British men were staying in the apartment from which Kirsty fell. But samples taken from under the bank workers fingernails, hands and armpits contain no foreign DNA, experts have revealed. And it now paves the way for Ana Isabel Garcia-Galbis in Spain to consider ending her -month criminal probe. A well-placed source in the country said today: The family had placed their hopes in the possibility something was going to be found, some biological evidence linking Joseph Graham or the other suspects to what happened and supporting their foul play claim, and absolutely nothing has been found.  It was a comprehensive examination which included analysis of the underside of Kirsty’s nails to seesamples of someone’s  skin could be recovered that might suggest a struggle had taken place. All the tests came back negative. The absence of any incriminating DNA on Kirsty’s body means the case is a step nearer to being closed. No decision on closure is obviously going to be taken before the upcoming court hearings but bar some sort of unexpected surprise, things are a lot nearer that point now.  The five Brits being probed over Kirsty’s death, including -year-old Joseph Graham who was the only man arrested, would be spared trialthe case is closed and only a successful appeal by Kirsty’s family to a higher court could get it re-opened. Two of the men, from Nottingham, have been called to court today to give evidence. Eight police officers have been asked to attend a second hearing on Thursday November , which was originally understood to have been scheduled for October .  Both hearings will take place behind closed doors, as is customary in Spain where only trials take place in public. Kirsty, of Livingston, Scotland, died in April , just seven months after marrying Adam Maxwell. The grieving widower previously said: I won’t rest until I know the truth.

Met Office forecasters are watching the swirling vortex closely which could lead to the fourth named storm of the season – Deirdre. Ex-hurricane Oscar’s mph gusts cancelled fireworks displays in the north of England. As Christmas nears five more storms are forecast to land according to The Weather Company, the worlds biggest commercial forecaster. They will be called Deirdre, Erik, Freya, Gareth and Hannah. If the turbulent weather does materialise it would make  a record breaking one, with eight named storms hitting the UK in the year up until Christmas.  In  - the year storms were first named - five landed, followed by two in  and three in . Leon Brown, head of meteorological operations at The Weather Company’s Weather Channel arm, said: “Four more named Atlantic storms are expected by early December, plus the risk of a fth named storm before Christmas. “Travel disruption and wind gusts over mph in parts of the North and West are expected. “A stormy, mobile Atlantic pattern is forecast in early winter, before a colder pattern from New Year onwards as westerly winds ease.”
